alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Panola; Tate (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 1:50PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Lafayette, Marshall, eastern Tate, Benton and northeastern Panola Counties through 230 PM CST... At 150 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mt Pleasant to near Batesville. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Holly Springs, Batesville, Holly Springs National Forest, Wall Doxey State Park, John W Kyle State Park, Lamar, Sardis, Byhalia, Snow Lake Shores, Mt Pleasant, Cambridge, Harmontown, Bethlehem, Michigan City, Red Banks, Laws Hill, Barr, Canaan and Burgess. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for northeastern and northwestern Mississippi.
